Based on the search results, I found information about Polish adaptations of "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" including theatrical productions. Here's what I discovered:

## Polish Theatrical Adaptations

The search found references to theatrical productions in Polish theaters, including:

- Teatr Polski in Wrocław has staged "Przygody Tomka Sawyera" based on Mark Twain's work
- Teatr Bagatela has presented a musical and dance version of "Przygody Tomka Sawyera" directed by Krzysztof Materna
- Teatr im. Cypriana Kamila Norwida in Jelenia Góra produced the play with a premiere on April 29, 2001

## Film Adaptations

There was a Polish dubbed version of the 1938 American film, with Polish dubbing done at Studio Opracowań in Łodzi, directed by Mirosław Bartoszek with Polish texts by Janina Balkiewiczowa and Jan Czarny.

## Original Work Context

The original novel "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" by Mark Twain was published in 1876, with the first Polish edition appearing in 1901.

The search results show that "Przygody Tomka Sawyera" has been adapted multiple times for Polish theater stages, though specific information about radio plays (słuchowiska) was not found in these particular results. The theatrical adaptations appear to have been produced by various Polish theaters including major venues in Wrocław, Kraków (Bagatela), and Jelenia Góra.
